isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - CAB ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - TURN SIGNALS WITH SIGNAL-STAT TURN SIGNAL SWITCH AND WITH PEDESTAL MOUNTED TURN SIGNAL

svcproc.title: TURN SIGNALS WITH SIGNAL-STAT TURN SIGNAL SWITCH AND WITH PEDESTAL MOUNTED TURN SIGNAL

table.title: Turn Signals With Signal-Stat Turn Signal Switch And With Pedestal Mounted Turn Signal

entry.para: Disconnect conn. (422) and at circuit 70B, measure voltage to ground while service brakes are applied.
Refer to LIGHT SYSTEMS, TROUBLE- SHOOTING section for stop light switch circuit trouble- shooting.
Remove fuse F20 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair, Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F20 and at circuit 14D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14R or 14D, then repair.
Remove flasher from conn. (1) and measure voltage from circuit 55 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55, then repair.
At conn. (1) install a test jumper from circuit 55 to 55A. At (422) measure voltage from circuit 55A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55A, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to left and right positions. Do the signal lights now illuminate?
Move switch to left turn position and measure resistance from black wire to orange wire.
With switch in left turn position, measure resistance from black wire to yellow wire.
Move switch to right turn position and measure resistance from black wire to green wire.
With switch in right turn position, measure resistance from black wire to blue wire.
Move switch to neutral position and measure resistance from red wire to yellow wire.
With switch in neutral position, measure resistance from red wire to green wire.
Remove trailer left turn relay (R5), reconnect connector (422) and move turn signal switch to left turn position. At (R5) measure voltage from circuit 56F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56 or 56F, then repair.
Re-install trailer left turn relay. Do left turn trailer lights function properly?
Refer to CHASSIS ACCESSORIES, TROUBLE- SHOOTING section for trailer connection trouble- shooting.
Does left aux. turn light function properly?
Disconnect conn. (18) and measure voltage from circuit 56B to ground with turn signal switch in the left turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56B or 56, then repair.
With turn signal switch still in the left turn position, at (18) measure voltage from circuit 56B to 56-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 56-G or 11-G, then repair.
Circuits to left aux. turn light check good. Does light function properly?
Does left pedestal turn light function properly?
Disconnect conn. (2) and measure voltage from circuit 56A (going to turn signal switch) to ground with turn signal switch in the left turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A or 56, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (2). and disconnect conn. (511) or (503). At circuit 56A, with turn signal switch in the left turn position, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A, then repair.
At conn. (511) or 503), measure voltage from circuit 56A to 11-GD with turn signal switch in the left turn position.
Locate open or poor connection in ground path 11-GD, 11-GC,11-GB or 11-GF (USA); 11-GD, 11-GB or 11-GF (Canada), then repair
Circuits to left pedestal turn light check good. Reconnect connector (503). Does light function properly?
Does left rear turn light function properly?
Disconnect conn. (13) and measure voltage from circuit 56D to ground with turn signal switch in the left turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56D, then repair.
Circuits to left rear turn light check good. Reconnect conn. (13). Does light function properly?
Check ground wire and replace lamp or socket assembly if necessary.
Does right rear turn light function properly?
Disconnect conn. (13) and measure voltage from circuit 57D to ground with turn signal switch in the right turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57D, then repair.
Circuits to right rear turn light check good. Reconnect conn. (13). Does light function properly?
Check ground wire and replace defective lamp or socket assembly if necessary.
Does right front turn light function properly?
Disconnect conn. (2) and measure voltage from circuit 57A (going to turn signal switch) to ground with turn signal switch in the right turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57 or 57A, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (2), disconnect conn. (512) or (505), and at circuit 57A with turn signal switch in the right turn position, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57A, then repair.
At conn. (512) or (505), measure voltage from circuit 57A to 11-GF with turn signal switch in the right turn position.
Locate open or poor connection in ground path 11-GF, 11-GE, 11-GB or 11-GF, then repair.
Circuits to right pedestal turn light check good. Reconnect all connectors . Does light function properly?
Does right aux. turn light function properly?
Disconnect conn. (220) and measure voltage from circuit 57B to ground with turn signal switch in the right turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57B or 57, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (53) and reconnect (220). With turn signal switch still in right turn position, at (53) measure voltage from circuit 57B [going to (220)] to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57B, then repair.
With turn signal switch still in the right turn position, at (53) measure voltage from circuit 57B to 57-G.
Locate open or poor connection circuit 57-G or 11-GA, then repair.
Circuits to right aux. turn light check good. Does light function properly?
Remove trailer right turn relay (R6) and move turn signal switch to right turn position. At (R6) measure voltage from circuit 57F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57F or 57, then repair.
Re-install trailer right turn relay (R6). Do right turn trailer lights function properly?
Refer to CHASSIS ACCESSORIES, TROUBLE- SHOOTING section for trailer connection trouble- shooting.
Remove test jumper and re-install turn signal flasher. Do lights flash when turn signal switch is moved to a turn position?
Stop, tail, turn, and hazard signal light circuits check good.
